definitions.definition: accepted or deserving to be accepted as one of the best or most important of its kind

examples.text: I grew up listening to **classic rock**.
This classic novel was first published in 1938.

definitions.definition: with all the features you would expect to find; very typical

examples.text: This was a classic case of what not to do.
She displayed the classic symptoms of depression.
I made the classic mistake of clapping in a pause in the music!

definitions.definition: attractive, but simple and traditional in style or design; not affected by changes in fashion

examples.text: She was wearing a classic little black dress.
The shop specializes in classic English style.

definitions.definition: people say That’s classic! when they find something very funny, when they think somebody has been very stupid or when something annoying, but not surprising, happens

examples.text: She's not going to help? Oh, that's classic!

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French classique or Latin classicus ‘belonging to a class or division’, later ‘of the highest class’, from classis ‘a division of the Roman people, a grade, or a class of pupils’.
